parameters.description: Sets the target retention policy for the write. InfluxDB writes to the DEFAULT retention policy if you do not specify a retention policy.

parameters.description: Sets the precision for the supplied Unix time values. InfluxDB assumes that timestamps are in nanoseconds if you do not specify precision.

parameters.name: consistency
parameters.description: Sets the write consistency for the point. InfluxDB assumes that the write consistency is one if you do not specify consistency. See the InfluxEnterprise documentation for detailed descriptions of each consistency option.

insecureSkipVerify.description: True means any certificate presented by the kapacitor is accepted.  Typically used for self-signed certs. Probably should only be used for testing.

active.description: Indicates whether the kapacitor is the current kapacitor being used for a source

proxy.description: URL location of proxy endpoint for this kapacitor

rules.description: URL location of rules endpoint for this kapacitor

example.query: select max(usage_system) from telegraf.autogen.cpu group by time(10m)
select max(usage_system) from telegraf.autogen.cpu group by time(10m)

KapacitorNode.description: Represents a node in the kapacitor TICKscript graph

name.description: Name of the kapacitor node e.g. slack

args.description: All arguments to the named node

properties.description: All properties attached to the kapacitor node

Field.description: Represents a field to be returned from an InfluxQL query

value.description: value is the value of the field.  Meaning of the value is implied by the `type` key

type.description: type describes the field type. func is a function; field is a field reference

alias.description: Alias overrides the field name in the returned response.  Applies only if type is `func`

args.description: Args are the arguments to the function

KapacitorProperty.description: Represents a property attached to a node in the kapacitor TICKscript graph

name.description: Name of the kapacitor property e.g. channel for a slack ndoe

args.description: All arguments to the named property

name.description: The identifying name of the retention policy

duration.description: the duration of the retention policy

replication.description: how many copies of the data are stored in the cluster

shardDuration.description: the interval spanned by each shard group

default.description: Indicates whether this retention policy should be the default

self.description: Self link mapping to this resource

links.description: Links to paginated measurements, relative to the current page.

prev.description: Previous page of measurements, if not at the first page.

example.name: Untitled Rule
example.tickscript:
var db = 'telegraf'

var rp = 'autogen'

var measurement = 'cpu'

var groupBy = []

var whereFilter = lambda: TRUE

var period = 10m

var every = 30s

var name = 'Untitled Rule'

var idVar = name + ':{{.Group}}'

var message = 'too much spam'

var idTag = 'alertID'

var levelTag = 'level'

var messageField = 'message'

var durationField = 'duration'

var outputDB = 'chronograf'

var outputRP = 'autogen'

var outputMeasurement = 'alerts'

var triggerType = 'threshold'

var details = 'muh body'

var crit = 10

var data = stream
    |from()
        .database(db)
        .retentionPolicy(rp)
        .measurement(measurement)
        .groupBy(groupBy)
        .where(whereFilter)
    |window()
        .period(period)
        .every(every)
        .align()
    |max('usage_system')
        .as('value')

var trigger = data
    |alert()
        .crit(lambda: "value" > crit)
        .stateChangesOnly()
        .message(message)
        .id(idVar)
        .idTag(idTag)
        .levelTag(levelTag)
        .messageField(messageField)
        .durationField(durationField)
        .details(details)
        .alerta()

trigger
    |influxDBOut()
        .create()
        .database(outputDB)
        .retentionPolicy(outputRP)
        .measurement(outputMeasurement)
        .tag('alertName', name)
        .tag('triggerType', triggerType)

trigger
    |httpOut('output')

id.description: ID for this rule; the ID is shared with kapacitor

name.description: User facing name of the alerting rule

every.description: Golang duration string specifying how often the alert condition is checked

alerts.description: Array of alerting services to warn if the alert is triggered

alertNodes.description: Arguments and properties to add to alert

message.description: Message to send when alert occurs.

details.description: Template for constructing a detailed HTML message for the alert. (Currently, only used for email/smtp

trigger.description: Trigger defines the alerting structure; deadman alert if no data are received for the specified time range; relative alert if the data change relative to the data in a different time range; threshold alert if the data cross a boundary

change.description: Specifies if the change is percent or absolute

period.description: Length of time before deadman is alerted (golang duration)

shift.description: Amount of time to look into the past to compare to the present (golang duration)

value.description: Value is the boundary value when alert goes critical

dbrps.description: List of database retention policy pairs the task is allowed to access.

status.description: Represents if this rule is enabled or disabled in kapacitor

executing.description: Whether the task is currently executing.

type.description: Represents the task type where stream is data streamed to kapacitor and batch is queried by kapacitor.

error.description: Any error encountered when kapacitor executes the task.

created.description: Date the task was first created

modified.description: Date the task was last modified

last-enabled.description: Date the task was last set to status enabled

self.description: Self link pointing to this rule resource

kapacitor.description: Link pointing to the kapacitor proxy for this rule including the path query parameter.

output.description: Link pointing to the kapacitor httpOut node of the tickscript; includes the path query argument

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific data source.

name.description: User facing name of data source

username.description: Username for authentication to data source

sharedSecret.description: JWT signing secret for optional Authorization: Bearer to InfluxDB

url.description: URL for the time series data source backend (e.g. http://localhost:8086)

metaUrl.description: URL for the influxdb meta node

insecureSkipVerify.description: True means any certificate presented by the source is accepted.  Typically used for self-signed certs. Probably should only be used for testing.

default.description: Indicates whether this source is the default source

telegraf.description: Database where telegraf information is stored for this source

defaultRP.description: Default retention policy used in Host-related queries proxied to InfluxDB from the Host List and Host pages.

organization.description: Organization that this source belongs to, when Chronograf auth is in use

role.description: Not used currently. Can be used to designate a minimum role required to access this source.

self.description: Self link mapping to this resource

proxy.description: URL location of proxy endpoint for this source

write.description: URL location of write endpoint for this source

queries.description: URL location of the queries endpoint for this source

kapacitors.description: URL location of the kapacitors endpoint for this source

users.description: URL location of the users endpoint for this source

permissions.description: URL location of the permissions endpoint for this source

roles.description: Optional path to the roles endpoint IFF it is supported on this source

health.description: Path to determine if source is healthy

example.query: select $myfield from cpu where time > now() - 10m

tempVars.description: Template variables to replace within an InfluxQL query

TemplateVariable.description: Named variable within an InfluxQL query to be replaced with values

tempVar.description: String to replace within an InfluxQL statement

TemplateValue.description: Value use to replace a template in an InfluxQL query.  The type governs the output format

value.description: Specific value that will be encoded based on type

type.description: The type will change the format of the output value. tagKey/fieldKey are double quoted; tagValue are single quoted; csv and timeStamp are not quoted.

InfluxDB-Permissions.description: Permissions represent the entire set of permissions a InfluxDB User or InfluxDB Role may have

InfluxDB-Permission.description: Permission is a specific allowance for InfluxDB User or InfluxDB Role bound to a scope of the data source

scope.description: Describes if the permission is for all databases or restricted to one database

name.description: If the scope is database this identifies the name of the database

AllPermissions.description: All possible permissions for this particular datasource.  Used as a static list

self.description: Relative link back to the permissions endpoint

source.description: Relative link to host with these permissiosn

InfluxDB-Allowances.description: Allowances defines what actions a user can have on a scoped permission

items.description: OSS InfluxDB is READ and WRITE.  Enterprise is all others

id.description: ID is an opaque string that uniquely identifies this layout.

app.description: App is the user facing name of this Layout

measurement.description: Measurement is the descriptive name of the time series data.

cells.description: Cells are the individual visualization elements.

measurement.description: The measurement where data for this mapping is found

name.description: The application name which will be assigned to the corresponding measurement

x.description: X-coordinate of Cell in the Dashboard

y.description: Y-coordinate of Cell in the Dashboard

w.description: Width of Cell in the Dashboard

h.description: Height of Cell in the Dashboard

name.description: Title of Cell in the Dashboard

axes.description: The viewport for a Cell's visualizations

colors.description: Colors define encoding data into a visualization

legend.description: Legend define encoding of the data into a cell's legend

type.description: type is the style of the legend

orientation.description: orientation is the location of the legend with respect to the cell graph

verticalTimeAxis.description: verticalTimeAxis describes the orientation of the table by indicating whether the time axis will be displayed vertically

sortBy.description: sortBy contains the name of the series that is used for sorting the table

wrapping.description: wrapping describes the text wrapping style to be used in table cells

fixFirstColumn.description: fixFirstColumn indicates whether the first column of the table should be locked

fieldOptions.description: fieldOptions represent the fields retrieved by the query with customization options

timeFormat.description: timeFormat describes the display format for time values according to moment.js date formatting

decimalPoints.description: decimal points indicates whether and how many digits to show after decimal point

isEnforced.description: Indicates whether decimal point setting should be enforced

digits.description: The number of digits after decimal to display

self.description: Self link mapping to this resource

label.description: Optional Y-axis user-facing label for this query

range.description: Optional default range of the Y-axis

upper.description: Upper bound of the display range of the Y-axis

lower.description: Lower bound of the display range of the Y-axis

wheres.description: Defines the condition clauses for influxdb

groupbys.description: Defines the group by clauses for influxdb

example.label: # warnings
example.query: SELECT count("check_id") as "Number Warning" FROM consul_health_checks

label.description: Optional Y-axis user-facing label for this query

range.description: Optional default range of the Y-axis

upper.description: Upper bound of the display range of the Y-axis

lower.description: Lower bound of the display range of the Y-axis

source.description: Optional URI for data source for this query

name.description: the user-facing name of the dashboard

self.description: Self link mapping to this resource

DashboardColor.description: Color defines an encoding of a data value into color space

id.description: ID is the unique id of the cell color

type.description: Type is how the color is used.

hex.description: Hex is the hex number of the color

name.description: Name is the user-facing name of the hex color

value.description: Value is the data value mapped to this color

Axis.description: A description of a particular axis for a visualization

bounds.description: The extents of an axis in the form [lower, upper]. Clients determine whether bounds are to be inclusive or exclusive of their limits

label.description: label is a description of this Axis

prefix.description: Prefix represents a label prefix for formatting axis values.

suffix.description: Suffix represents a label suffix for formatting axis values.

base.description: Base represents the radix for formatting axis values.

scale.description: Scale is the axis formatting scale. Supported: "log", "linear"

RenamableField.description: renamableField describes a field that can be renamed and made visible or invisible

internalName.description: internalName is the calculated name of a field

displayName.description: displayName is the name that a field is renamed to by the user

visible.description: visible indicates whether this field should be visible on the table

mappings.description: Location of the application mappings endpoint

external.description: external links provided to client, ex. status feed URL

statusFeed.description: link to a JSON Feed for the News Feed on client's Status Page

custom.description: a collection of custom links set by the user to be rendered in the client User menu
